Company Profile: King Technologies Co,.LTD. operates telecommunication services based on cable such as copper cable (ADSL, Broadband,etc..) and fiber cable for premium service such as FTTH , Leased Line, etc... Supporting the very latest in multimedia and internet services with the highest technology over the world. Its extensive nationwide network coverage is available in all 8 provinces in Cambodia (Phnom Penh, Siem Reap, Kampong Cham, Kampong Thom, Sihanouk Ville, Battambong, Banteay Meanchey ). The company’s workforce consists of more than 500 people including local and foreign experts. Clients are individuals, businesses, research and educational organizations, NGOs, and departments of the Royal Government of Cambodia.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department  012 626 789/ 096 416 63 63 No 49, Street 306, Sangkat Beoung Kengkang 1, Khan Chamkarmon, Phnom Penh  012 626 789/ 096 416 63 63

Company Profile:
Cambodia Post Bank Plc. (CP Bank) is a full licensing commercial bank, offering financial solutions to aspiring individuals and enterprises in Cambodia. CP Bank is a strategic partnership between Canadia Investment Holding Plc., Cambodia’s Ministry of Post and Telecommunications and Fullerton Financial Holdings Pte. Ltd. Opened in September 2013, CP Bank offers its customers a suite of loan and deposit products, as well as remittance and FX services, for their personal and business needs. With a clear strategic direction and long term commitment, in a few years ahead, CP Bank will expand the branch network to more than 100 branch offices across Cambodia.

We recognize our greatest asset is our people. That is why we are creating a unique climate of inspiration, leadership and great opportunities that will enable the best in market to thrive a part of our diverse team. 

To support our growth for 2015 with the expansion of more than 40 branches network and more than 1300 employees, we are now looking for recruiting customer-oriented and motivated individuals for the following positions to join us in our journey to grow our business and people.
Contact Info: Contact Information Recruitment Unit  023 220 772-3-4 / 070 6000 49 No.265-269, St.Ang Duong, Sangkat Wat Phnom, Khan Doun Penh, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  023 220 772-3-4 / 070 6000 49

Job Description:
• Assist the internal audit Manager in preparing the annual audit plan

• Assists in providing training, coaching, and guidance to internal audit staffs in conducting audit and other related issues.

• Performs financial, operational and credit audits in accordance with the internal audit programs and procedures, as assigned by Audit Manager or Team Leader, including identifying and defining issues, developing criteria, reviewing and analyzing evidences, and documenting business processes and procedures.

• Update audit programs and audit check list.

• Analyze operational and management processes weakness, and provide the evidential 

supports for report recommendations.

• Review the internal auditors’ work. 

• Documents the findings/issues, drafts the recommendations using independent Languages to submit Audit Manager for reviewing. 

• Builds and maintain respectful and effective communication and relationship with teams, managements and staffs of areas under review. 

• Take the role of Audit Manager or Team Leader if he or she is on leave or absent. 

• Maintains confidentiality of bank and customer affairs in accordance with standards of professional conduct of auditors. 

• Performs related works as assigned by Audit Manager or Team Leader.

Job Description:
Key Responsibilities:
• Ensure integration of the systems chosen and project manage SIT,UAT & Implementation

• Ensure a strong business support team is built to support BAU (including system access control)

• Build a small production Support organization to ensure smooth running of production systems including interfacing to 3rd party / outsourced infrastructure

• Design & Own IT architecture (Functional & Technical) for IT MFI Landscape

• Working knowledge of Core Banking Functionality (Product Management/Setup, Teller, FT

• Debit Cards/ATM Management/Payments, Transaction Banking, Mobile / Interface Banking etc.

• Manage IT Vendor relationships and be able to negotiate commercials

• Manage user requirements, gaps/issues, vendor management, UAT & implementation

• Manage and ensure Up-Keep of Production Systems (SLA near 100%)

• Face-off to CP Bank’s (CXOs) Senior Management team

• Ensure vendor documentations are up-to-date.

• Develop Application Roadmap for all the functional area

• Train / develop user / IT community

• Development and Up-keep of IT Policy including Information Security Policy, Procedure & SOPs

• Aligning the IT department with this Information Security policy.

Key Competencies required:
• Facilitate and gather requirements / gaps against chosen systems

• Review and validate the System Integrators deliverable to ensure integration across systems 

(Customer, Product and Process)

• Ensure IT Partners provide solution to business requirements

• Keep up-to-date with the industry knowledge on the best practices and new MFI products

• Develop new analytical approaches and methodologies (find solutions for gaps in the IT landscape example: New types of Loans/ Overdrafts, Deposits & Investment accounts)

• Manage vendor’s contracts and deliverables

• Excellent verbal conversation and written communication

• Excellent vendor management

• Great negotiation skills

• Excellent leadership skills to build and develop the IT teams and face-off the management team

• Coaching & Training

Job Description:
- This position will work with children from 0 to 3 years old 
- To seek advice and report from Head of Early Childhood Education and Care for Nursery staff
and non-staff any issues at all areas and supervise appropriate leadership.
- To guide and support subordinate staff in implementing the Nursery Curriculum, policy, and 
other rules as need. 
- To monitor children’s progress and evaluate the effectiveness of planning, teaching, 
assessment and record keeping in all areas of learning.
- To organize resources for the Nursery and consider any further resource needs and their effective placement, and to maintain an up to date inventory.
- To ensure that staff are aware of the availability, location and correct and safe use of resources.
- To prepare orders for new resources, after discussions with colleagues and the Head of Early 
Childhood Education when appropriate, and to evaluate needs, acting within the budgetary guidelines
- To supervise, trains and utilizes assistant teacher’s (and volunteer’s) skills and abilities.
- To works with other staff members to form a positive, supportive team atmosphere.
- Performs additional program duties as assigned by the Head of Early Childhood Education and Care. 
- Monitor and maintain all equipment in good repair to ensure safety
- To orientate the new Nursery teachers about curriculum, policy, schedule and other activities
- Evaluates staff performance (bi-yearly and yearly)

This role provides an opportunity to work with a highly prestigious international NGO, Cambodian Children’s Fund, www.cambodianchildrensfund.org. - មានចំណេះដឹងបច្ចេកទេសអំពីគ្រឿងម៉ាស៊ីនរថយន្ត

Company Profile:
Welcome to Aplus Group

We welcome you to Aplus Consulting, considered Cambodia’s most sort after human resource partners. Established in 2008 to provide human resource and tax solutions to local and international companies in Cambodia. Our young and dynamic company has experienced significant growth and now partners with more than 100 organisations, with almost 1,000 employees placed throughout the country.1

We have built a strong team of highly qualified and experienced local and international professionals, bringing their knowledge and expertise of legal, accounting, employee migration, talent acquisition and human resource management and development. We measure our own success from the trust our clients continue to place in us to provide sustainable support services and to grow their human potential.

We sustain the heart we bring to business with our commitment to community development. We partner with universities, scholarship programs and village education to support the academic advancement of young Cambodians. We demand a lot from our team and we commend them for the extra mile they go to volunteer their time, providing on call support for village to city migrating students and  preparation for work  advice and coaching.

We sincerely thank our team, our partners, our clients for helping us to reach a stage where we can proudly hold up SME1 Asia Awards 2012. We promise to only get better at our work and our services for our sustainable success for all.
Contact Info: Contact Information Ngoy Manith (Mr.)   017 206 333/010 200 005/023 991 003 No.36, St.169, PPIU Building, 4th Floor, Veal Vong, 7 Makara, Phnom Penh, Cambodia   017 206 333/010 200 005/023 991 003

Job Requirement:
- Minimum High School Diploma, Business School and/or Hotel School Diploma preferred.
- Minimum two year experience in Catering, exposure to Banquet operation is a plus.
- Minimum three years experience in a luxury Hotel environment.
- Candidate must have flexible schedule and ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
- Must be results oriented, enthusiastic and a strong team player
- Must be able to prioritize, organize and be self-efficient.
- Computer experience at intermediate to advanced level is mandatory with knowledge of Windows 2003 (Excel, PowerPoint and Word, Access) 
- Must be flexible in terms of working hours especially during peak periods.
- Must possess good Sales skills, guest service skills, professional presentation and sophisticated communication skills.
- Proficient in English language (Verbal and written), second language is an asset.
Company Profile:
Raffles Hotels & Resorts is a collection of award-winning luxury hotels located in vibrant destinations around the world. Unique with its own distinct personality, each Raffles hotel distinguishes itself with the highest standards of product and service. 

We offer excellent career development and growth opportunities for our colleagues who have the talent, dedication, drive and passion to be part of leading global luxury hospitality brand.

Raffles Grand Hotel d'Angkor set across from the Royal Palace is one of the great hotels of the legendary Grand Tour of Indochina. Embraced by 15 acres of beautifully landscaped French gardens, this legendary meeting place combines old-world grandeur with peace and tranquility in one of the world's most spiritual destinations. It was opened in 1929. It is currently run by the Fairmont Raffles Hotels International group.

If you are looking for a dynamic environment for growth, please join us as:
Contact Info: Contact Information Eung Chantra HR Manager 85563963888 1 Vithei Charles du Gaulle, Khum Svay Dang Kum, Siem Reap, Kingdom of Cambodia  85563963888

Job Description:
• Daily stock controlling –Stock in and Stock out
• Daily update stock inventories and report to head office
• Inventories stock report to head office everyday
• Weekly and monthly report to head office
• Keeping record and maintaining cycle counts of entire inventories in stock
• Receiving and verifying the inventory with delivery order listing
• Report lost, damage and any broken to supervising authority
• Maintaining all proper documents processed for the receipt of goods and supplier
• Manage all inventories in stock
• Other tasks assigned by directly supervisor

• No need experience or Have experience one year (1 year +)
• Good computer skills, Microsoft offices (Word, Excel)
• Age at least 25- 35 years old
• Hard working person, honesty
• Willing to work under pressure
• Able to work overtime
• Be self-confident, self-motivated

+ Benefit
- get high salary
- have money (motivation) for regular work
- Provide food 3 times per day
- provide room to stay in company
- work from Monday to Saturday 
- day off Sunday

Job Description:
- Meet clients and ensure that all requests are being answered in a prompt manner, and alternative offered.
- Coordinates activities related to booked business with other departments and suppliers
- Ensures that up selling is being conducted at all times
- Maintains records of all correspondences
- Keeps and update data of regular clients by market segments and amount of revenues spent to date.
- Prepares and send proposals for every function.
- Prepare and send contracts for every function.
- Ensure that all guide lines and policies and procedures of the hotel are being followed.
- Ensure that during each function we are meeting the guest’s expectations and requirements.
- Ensure to contact every guest after each function to collect feedback
- Insure that when a reservation is being taken a cut off date is being given for confirmation and deposit.
- Conduct regular outside sales calls to solicit existing and new guests (minimum 3 per week)
- Communicates guests requests to all departments in an effective and timely manner by insuring that function sheets are being issued at least 3days (72 hours) before the event starts
- Ensure that for all functions a contract is signed by the Hotel and the client
- Attends at least once a week the Hotel sales and Marketing meeting.
- Maintain all bookings and enquiries in an orderly manner
- Communicates and informs the Executive chef and FBM of any special or unusual requests.
- Keep track of all costs and ensure that expected margin is met before sending out a proposal.
- Follow up and contact previous year’s business and initiatives.
- Coordinate and consult The hotel sales department for all bookings and enquiries
- Check every morning the billing of the previous day’s function and ensures that it has been posted correctly.
